text:
Shared bottle @CafesTesexperience. Pours black with creamy head. Aroma of nuts, caramel and pine. Roasty taste. Light bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Shared bottle at Cafes Tes. Dark brown with beige head. Chocolate aromas. Oily but very refreshing. Sweet caramel with a bitter end that lasts a bit.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruit, liquorice, tropical fruit, chocolate, roasted malts, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown/black beer with a slight/medium beige/brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit, liquorice, tropical fruit and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts, hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Loads of tropical fruit and liquorice, with everything a black IPA needs. Perfect appearance and a great palate as well, but the aroma could have been stronger.
On tap at Vrteka 2017. Pours black with medium beige head. Nice hoppy pine aroma, chocolate, malty, rye. Lasting bitter finish. Medium bodied. Nice one.
On tap. Dark color wit tan head. Malty aroma, with some citrus notes. Taste of pineapple, caramel and roasted malt. Good one.
One of the best black IPAs i have ever tasted. Great mouthfeel, taste is complex, smooth.

Thanks to whoever shared this with me! :) Pungent aroma, chocolate, rye/dark bread, creamy. Light bitterness in the taste, perfumey, chocolate and light orange notes from the hols. Interesring and nice.

Bottle split at L42, thanks to Kenny, 14/03/17.
Light black with a decent tan cap.
Nose is pine needle, biscuit, toffee, light black peppery spice, jammy berry fruits.
Taste comprises light charr, subtle roast, toffee, cocoa sprinkle, pine dusting.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with earthy hop bitterness.
Decent enough CDA but far from TOP 50 material for me.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Pretty much black with a large light tan head. Spiced chocolate brioche aroma with floaty grapefruit and orange blossoms, some nectarine. Soft texture, medium bodied. Like a number other BIPAs I like, carbonation is on the low side of medium - it seems to bring out the chocolate whilst still giving the citrusy hops room to move. The chocolate, bread and caramel malty flavours are nice but maybe a bit simpler than suggested in the aroma - the rye doesnt get up to much really. Fairly bitter at a finish that dries out only a little. Floral and citrus notes linger.

Como debería ser una black IPA con centeno, y punto! No estará de acuerdo el bjcp pero la presencia de notas tostadas y torrefactas, con un cuerpo sedoso y viscoso es lo que busco en el estilo. Sumado al centeno, su característica burbuja y su punto especiado, el cítrico del amarillo y nueva dosis especiada y resinosa del simcoe, el resultado es un paso te. Ahora ponlo en una botella guapa y de 50 CL y puedes ir a dormir tranquilo!

Color negro con capa de espuma marrón (muy cremosa, grumosa y de muy buena retención). Carbonatación alta. Textura cremosa. Aroma a lúpulo suave, resina, chocolate, café, malta torrefacta. Sabor lupulado, torrefacto, con mucho café y chocolate. Amargor suave y bien calibrado. Postgusto a chocolate y café. Riquísima e increíblemente bien hecha. A tres meses de caducar y una delicia. Recién embotellada tiene que ser increíble.

14th March 201742nd Floor Bottleshare. Almost opaque dark brown beer, good pale tan head. Smooth palate, semi dry. Reasonable carbonation. Smooth dark malts, mild bitterish roast. Bitterish dark chocolate, well integrated. Modest floral hop and light pine. Smooth finish. Nice CDA but Top 50?

On tap, @BBF 2017, Barcelona 26/03/17
Color marron oscuro, corona de espuma blanca, aromas a cacao con notas a malta el sabor es tostado maltoso, cuerpo sedoso, rica.
On tap at BBF. Black colour with beige head. Pineapple and malt aroma. Sweet, tropical fruits, chocolate, rye taste. Medium body.

March 2017 - Bottle share at One Canada Square. Thanks Kenny! As Tuatara Tu-Rye-Ay Midnight Rye IPA, 7.5%. Opaque black with a dense foamy light brown head, leaving light lacing. Aroma is piney, stones, flint. Body is frothy with soft carbonation. Taste is pine, flint, chalky, salt, earthy and woody into the finish. Good hoppy CDA. (3.9)

Tap @ KApina.
Pours dark red, almost black color with a thick beige head. Aroma is hoppy and very roasty, malty and slightly sweet with caramel and licorice notes. Bitter malty and roasted dry flavor, caramel sweetness, lots of hops, some citric fruits on the finish. Quite nice.
4525

Bottle shared in London - big thanks to Kenworth. Pours rich brown with a dense, frothy beige head. Classic aroma, some burnt pine, light chocolate, zesty orange, well toasted bread. Medium sweet flavour wth well toasted brown bread, light coffee, cocoa, scorched earth. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Finishes with burnt pine, dusty cocoa, scorched earth. Great all around CDA.

Bottle shared on Level 42 14/03/2017. Many thanks to Kenny for this one. A dark brown black coloured pour with a loose mid tan head. Aroma is sweet toasted nutty malts, hazelnut, woody pine. Flavour is composed of semi sweet, nutty, woody pine, semi sweet nutty malts, vanilla. Palate is semi sweet, vanilla, moderate, semi sweet. Really good black ipa.

Bottle at L42. It pours cloudy darkest brown with a small tan head. The aroma is soft, sweet, piney, varnish, tangy, camp, rocky road, spicy, earth and tangy meat. The taste is slick dry, bitter - sweet, earthy, toasty, charred wood, earth, cacoa and rocky road with a. Dry, toasty finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Dent cda.

500ml bottle. Pours black in colour with a creamy beige head leaving lacing. Nose of roasted malts with citrusy hops. Flavour is malt, roasted, rye, bready, some chocolate & coffee hints, and orange citrusy hop bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry roasted bitter finish. Very drinkable Black IPA.
500ml bottle pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Dark roasted malt flavors and nice hop bitterness to balance.

Pours pitch black with a medium white head, some spotted lacing. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus and some roasted malts. Taste feels very fruity, with a good balance of roasted malts, some hoppy bitterness, notes of coffee. Medium bodied, smooth, with a medium bitterness, soft carbonation. Very tasty and enjoyable.

500ml bottle at home bought at Beer Republic. No obvious BB date. almost black color, rather big coffee-colored head. smells earthy, grassy, licorice, light chocolate, bit soapy, some pines, rather lovely smell. full body, light carbonation, soft mouthfeel. tastes ash, bitter herbal, bit citric, bit old hoppy, dusty, some charcoal. finishes lightly bitter with notes of licorice, old hops and some charcoal. hmm, smell was quite nice, but taste has some problems, first, too light carbonation, which makes the beer unpleasant and boring to drink, then too much on the bitter charcoal / ashy side lacks some balance. Might be an issue with freshness, but since there is no BB date ... how should I know..

Mild, dark roast, chocolate, grain malts, dry cacao. Very dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Light bitter. More dark roast malts, chocolate, citrus fruits, lemon, grass, soft carbonation, medium bodied, light bitterness in the finish. Nice Black IPA, but not more, its nice, not getting the hype though, seriously lacks complexity for more. Bottle from HonestBrew, Crystal Palace.

500 ml bottle. BB 04/07/17. Thanks to Kiwi-Timo!
Black color with a medium size foamy tan head.
Roasted malt, hops, some bitterness, some oatmeal and mild sweetness in the aroma. 
The flavor is pungent hops, pine, roasted malt, chocolate and some age.

Bottle from The Beerhive. Dark brown body with a creamy beige head that holds well. Good lacing. Aroma of coffee, caramel and black pepper. Flavour of spicy rye, blackcurrant, Coca-Cola and orange zest. Medium to full body with a smooth texture. Soft fizz. A peppery, luxurious Black IPA.
Keg at drygate... Dark black thick tan head.. Dark roast.. Big chocolate.. Heavy meat chocolate roast malts nose

Tap at Craft, Sukhumvit, Bangkok. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is smoky roast malt, grassy hop citrus. The flavour is moderate bitter with a dry crisp fruity light pepper spice palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Drank the day Clinton lost to Trump. Boohoo. Beautiful opaque black pour, watery, tan creamy head with foamy spotty lacing. Smells very nice, toasty biscuity malt, resin bitterness, light orange and pith, dark plum and even a bit of red wine. Taste is moderate to heavy bitterness, moderate to heavy acidity/burnt coffee, frothy chewy lightly chocolate finish. Body is medium, slick, sticky with a frothy chalky lightly sharp finish. Nose and palate are excellent. Quite malty, not quite as dark as I usually like my black IPAs but has a nice acid coffee bite (though taste a little too much) and lots of toastiness and dark fruit.

Bottle from Brewcraft at home on Election Day. Rich black pour with dense tan head. Aroma is good - light roasted coffee and sharp pine hops. Taste is sharp pine bitterness with burnt acerbity. Some spiciness and booziness. Lasting sharp bitterness. Really good.

Deep brown, almost black pour with a thick tan head. Looks spectacular. Tropical fruit, roast,chocolate, spicy, coffee aromas. Taste is roasty, piney, passionfruit, coffee and nice combination of hoppy and roasty bitterness. Its pretty damn good.

Pours very dark brown with reddish hues. Great thick tan coloured creamy head which dissipates a little but remains throughout and leaves thick lacing on the glass. Aromas of roasted malt, vanilla, coffee and slight floral wafts as well. Thick luscious mouthfeel, initial sweet spice, black plumbs and bitter dark chocolate on the tongue. Hop resin then kicks in before the roasted malt takes its turn to take over proceedings. Very interesting complexity, finishes with a nice bitterness that I suspect is more from the malt rather than hops. Enjoyable drinking indeed, excellent Black IPA, guessing about 60-70 IBU, 7.5% ABV

I've had plenty of black IPAs, but there's something about a black eye IPA that takes things to the next level. Aroma of watermelon, passion fruit, mandarin and coffee. Flavour is deliciously balanced. Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A gorgeous looking beer. This is more malty than a traditional black ipa. Lacking in hops. A great black beer and a sweet alcohol taste.

500ml bottle. Pours pitch black with plenty of fluffy tan head. Aroma is spicy, coffee, its a black rye for sure. Flavour is coffee, spice, port, smoke, little pine. Theres not much hoppiness, but who cares when it tastes this good. Gorgeous, if not truly in style.

500ml bottle BB 4/7/17 so nice and fresh then.
Floral hoppy aroma.
Pours dark brown/black with tan head.
Malt notes but its the hops that are the star of the show here.
A beer I could quite easily sit on all night if it was on tap down at my Greenhithe local.
Definitely worth the effort guys/gals.

Pours block with a large off-white head.
Nose shows resinous piny hops as well as lychee notes with some caramel and a little toasty malt underneath.
Flavours include caramel, toasty and roasty malt, hints of coffee, booze and piny hops.

Bottle from Wine Emporium 181215. This is the type of beer that you can really get your teeth into. I can see where the midnight part fits into the name, with a reference on the label to Dexeys Midnight Runners but also the thick black colour of this beer is reminiscent of the witching hour on a moonless dark night. In the mouth this beer is smooth as silk with a combination of chocolate and malt aromas and flavours and fills the mouth with a creaminess that leads to a long finish. As always with Tuatara Brewing this beer comes in a bottle with the scaley "skin" of the tuatara, the reptile native to New Zealand that this brewery is named after.
Enticing citrus pine aroma in a jet black pour. Expected hop forward balance with full body and an interesting spicy twist. Finish is nice and sustained to end.
Definitely fruity hops on the nose, pineapple, strawberry and more. Accompanied by a rich and complex malt base with well balanced sweetness to bitterness. Slight spice in the finish. Very tasty.

This isnt so much a beer as a staple food. A kind of ploughmans lunch. But, lets face it, if ploughmen had this kind of lunch, wed all be ploughmen. Theres plenty of hoppiness in this ale, but the hops are not the star of the show, they are there to prise open the cracks and windows in what might otherwise be a solid, impenetrable wall of malt. The hops are there to let the (flavoured) air in. They open it up: I taste the hops, but then I am immediately dragged into to the delicious roasty/burnt/cured meat gritty malt that carries the hops. Delicious, warming, low-med bitterness, spicy black pepper at the end. Vitamin B for Africa. Cannot taste the 7.5% ABV. I really want another one.
